intro: Cyclamen × drydeniae, commonly known as the hybrid cyclamen, is a perennial flowering plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens and indoor settings. The plant produces vibrant blooms in shades of pink, red, and white, typically in late winter to early spring. Cyclamen × drydeniae thrives in cool, moist environments and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Its foliage and flowers make it a popular choice for winter bedding plants and container gardening.
